alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 7:39PM CDT until August 14 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Kimball County in the panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 945 PM MDT. * At 639 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kimball, Dix and Kimball Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 15 and 34. This includes the following streams and drainages... Jacinto Draw, Pine Bluffs Draw, Lodgepole Creek, Sand Draw, Potter Draw, Panorama Point Draw, Lindbergh Draw, Sidney Draw, Rush Creek, North Sidney Draw, Dix Draw and Rocky Hollow. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
